document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FC996310DFE30131978468A86D17958E.description: Describe how artists (e.g., architects, book illustrators, muralists, industrial designers) have affected people's lives.

FC98C300DFE30131978268A86D17958E.description: Look at images in figurative works of art and predict what might happen next, telling what clues in the work support their ideas.

FC982970DFE30131978068A86D17958E.description: Write a poem or story inspired by their own works of art.

FC97E250DFE30131977F68A86D17958E.description: Describe how costumes contribute to the meaning of a dance.

FC974D90DFE30131977D68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC96F7D0DFE30131977C68A86D17958E.description: Select an artist's work and, using appropriate vocabulary of art, explain its successful compositional and communicative qualities.

FC96A610DFE30131977B68A86D17958E.description: Identify successful and less successful compositional and expressive qualities of their own works of art and describe what might be done to improve them.

FC961510DFE30131977968A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast selected works of art and describe them, using appropriate vocabulary of art.

FC957810DFE30131977768A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FC951C20DFE30131977668A86D17958E.description: Write about a work of art that reflects a student's own cultural background.

FC94B7E0DFE30131977568A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe objects of art from different parts of the world observed in visits to a museum or gallery (e.g., puppets, masks, containers).

FC9415E0DFE30131977368A86D17958E.description: Distinguish and describe representational, abstract, and nonrepresentational works of art.

FC93BB20DFE30131977268A86D17958E.description: Identify artists from his or her own community, county, or state and discuss local or regional art traditions.

FC936500DFE30131977168A86D17958E.description: Compare and describe various works of art that have a similar theme and were created at different time periods.

FC930FF0DFE30131977068A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FC92C6A0DFE30131976F68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FC927EA0DFE30131976E68A86D17958E.description: Create an original work of art emphasizing rhythm and movement, using a selected printing process.

FC9235B0DFE30131976D68A86D17958E.description: Create an imaginative clay sculpture based on an organic form.

FC91EAF0DFE30131976C68A86D17958E.description: Create a work of art based on the observation of objects and scenes in daily life, empha-sizing value changes.

FC919D70DFE30131976B68A86D17958E.description: Paint or draw a landscape, seascape, or cityscape that shows the illusion of space.

FC914720DFE30131976A68A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FC90F8E0DFE30131976968A86D17958E.description: Mix and apply tempera paints to create tints, shades, and neutral colors.

FC90ACD0DFE30131976868A86D17958E.description: Explore ideas for art in a personal sketchbook.

FC9013F0DFE30131976668A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FC8FA540DFE30131976568A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe elements of art in works of art, emphasizing line, color, shape/ form, texture, space, and value.

FC8F3E30DFE30131976468A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FC8EEBD0DFE30131976368A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast two works of art made by the use of different art tools and media (e.g., watercolor, tempera, computer).

FC8E9710DFE30131976268A86D17958E.description: Identify and describe how foreground, middle ground, and background are used to create the illusion of space.

FC8E4340DFE30131976168A86D17958E.description: Describe how artists use tints and shades in painting.

FC8DE960DFE30131976068A86D17958E.description: Perceive and describe rhythm and movement in works of art and in the environment.

FC68CF60DFE30131975F68A86D17958E.description: Develop Perceptual Skills and Visual Arts Vocabulary

FC688B40DFE30131975E68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FC67FC40DFE30131975C68A86D17958E.description: Develop problem-solving and communication skills by participating collaboratively in theatrical experiences.

FC673B20DFE30131975A68A86D17958E.description: Use problem-solving and cooperative skills to dramatize a story or a current event from another content area, with emphasis on the five Ws.

FC66A920DFE30131975868A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC665DC0DFE30131975768A86D17958E.description: Compare the content or message in two different works of theatre.

FC6612A0DFE30131975668A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FC65CBD0DFE30131975568A86D17958E.description: Develop and apply appropriate criteria or rubrics for evaluating a theatrical experience.

FC653480DFE30131975368A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FC64EB80DFE30131975268A86D17958E.description: Identify universal themes in stories and plays from different periods and places.

FC6443A0DFE30131975068A86D17958E.description: Dramatize different cultural versions of similar stories from around the world.

FC63E7E0DFE30131974F68A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FC636810DFE30131974E68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FC632380DFE30131974D68A86D17958E.description: Create for classmates simple scripts that demonstrate knowledge of basic blocking and stage areas.

FC629240DFE30131974B68A86D17958E.description: Participate in cooperative scriptwriting or improvisations that incorporate the five Ws.

FC61F010DFE30131974968A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FC6195D0DFE30131974868A86D17958E.description: Identify who, what, where, when, and why (the five Ws) in a theatrical experience.

FC614E60DFE30131974768A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FC6105D0DFE30131974668A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre, such as character, setting, conflict, audience, motivation, props, stage areas, and blocking, to describe theatrical experiences.

FC60BC10DFE30131974568A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FC607130DFE30131974468A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FC5FBE40DFE30131974268A86D17958E.description: Identify what musicians and composers do to create music.

FC5EEE30DFE30131974068A86D17958E.description: Identify the use of similar elements in music and other art forms (e.g., form, pattern, rhythm).

FC5E57C0DFE30131973E68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC5E0200DFE30131973D68A86D17958E.description: Select and use specific criteria in making judgments about the quality of a musical performance.

FC5D74A0DFE30131973B68A86D17958E.description: Describe how specific musical elements communicate particular ideas or moods in music.

FC5D3120DFE30131973A68A86D17958E.description: Create developmentally appropriate movements to express pitch, tempo, form, and dynamics.

FC5CA5E0DFE30131973868A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FC5C4FB0DFE30131973768A86D17958E.description: Identify the uses of music in various cultures and time periods.

FC5BB7F0DFE30131973568A86D17958E.description: Identify differences and commonalities in music from various cultures.

FC5B6C40DFE30131973468A86D17958E.description: Play memorized songs from diverse cultures.

FC5B2020DFE30131973368A86D17958E.description: Sing memorized songs from diverse cultures.

FC5A6CA0DFE30131973168A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FC5A12C0DFE30131973068A86D17958E.description: Create short rhythmic and melodic phrases in question-and-answer form.

FC597280DFE30131972E68A86D17958E.description: Play rhythmic and melodic ostinatos on classroom instruments.

FC592630DFE30131972D68A86D17958E.description: Sing age-appropriate songs from memory, including rounds, partner songs, and ostinatos.

FC58D290DFE30131972C68A86D17958E.description: Sing with accuracy in a developmentally appropriate range.

FC583400DFE30131972A68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FC57ED30DFE30131972968A86D17958E.description: Identify simple musical forms (e.g., AABA, AABB, round).

FC57A670DFE30131972868A86D17958E.description: Describe the way in which sound is produced on various instruments.

FC575790DFE30131972768A86D17958E.description: Identify visually and aurally the four families of orchestral instruments and male and female adult voices.

FC570790DFE30131972668A86D17958E.description: Identify melody, rhythm, harmony, and timbre in selected pieces of music when pre-sented aurally.

FC56C310DFE30131972568A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FC567DC0DFE30131972468A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform pentatonic patterns, using solfège.

FC563760DFE30131972368A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform simple rhythmic patterns using eighth notes, quarter notes, half notes, dotted half notes, whole notes, and rests.

FC559350DFE30131972168A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FC54E8B0DFE30131971F68A86D17958E.description: Give examples of ways in which the activities of professionals in the performing arts are similar to each other (e.g., observing discipline, practicing skills, rehearsing perfor-mances).

FC549CB0DFE30131971E68A86D17958E.description: Explain how the time management, problem solving, and self-discipline skills required for composing a dance apply to other school activities.

FC545290DFE30131971D68A86D17958E.description: Development of Life Skills and Career Competencies

FC5403E0DFE30131971C68A86D17958E.description: Describe how dancing develops physical and mental well-being (e.g., control, flexibility, posture, strength, risk taking).

FC53AC10DFE30131971B68A86D17958E.description: Explain relationships between dance elements and other subjects (e.g., spatial path-ways—maps and grids; geometric shapes—body shapes).

FC531330DFE30131971968A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC52AA00DFE30131971868A86D17958E.description: Explain how a performer's dance skills contribute to communication of ideas and moods when performing a dance (e.g., focus, strength, coordination).

FC51ED60DFE30131971668A86D17958E.description: Explain and demonstrate what it means to be a good audience member.

FC51A580DFE30131971568A86D17958E.description: Name specific criteria to assess the quality of a dance performance of peers (e.g., focus, level of personal involvement, physical control).

FC515C80DFE30131971468A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FC5113E0DFE30131971368A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FC50CCF0DFE30131971268A86D17958E.description: Name and demonstrate dances of Native Americans.

FC502A70DFE30131971068A86D17958E.description: Describe how costumes and shoes influence dance movement.

FC4FE220DFE30131970F68A86D17958E.description: Explain the function of dance in ceremonial and social community events in Native American cultures.

FC4F4ED0DFE30131970D68A86D17958E.description: Describe and demonstrate ceremonial and folk/traditional dances that show work activities (e.g., harvesting, fishing, weaving).

FC4F0310DFE30131970C68A86D17958E.description: Describe commonalities among and differences between dances from various countries.

FC4E60E0DFE30131970A68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FC4E1810DFE30131970968A86D17958E.description: Create, memorize, and perform original movement sequences with a partner or a small group.

FC4DC2A0DFE30131970868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate a variety of partner skills (e.g., imitation, leading/following, mirroring).

FC4D6AC0DFE30131970768A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FC4CFAB0DFE30131970668A86D17958E.description: Compare and contrast the role of the performer with that of a member of the audience.

FC4C8F60DFE30131970568A86D17958E.description: Perform dances to communicate personal meaning, using focus and expression.

FC4C0180DFE30131970368A86D17958E.description: Create a wide variety of shapes and movements, using different levels in space.

FC4BBC60DFE30131970268A86D17958E.description: Create a sequence that has a beginning, a middle, and an end. Name and refine the parts of the sequence.

FC4B7450DFE30131970168A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FC4B2870DFE30131970068A86D17958E.description: Improvise and select multiple possibilities to solve a given movement problem (e.g., find four different ways to combine a turn, stretch, and jump).

FC4AC7E0DFE3013196FF68A86D17958E.description: Create and perform complex improvised movement patterns, dance sequences, and studies.

FC4A3F30DFE3013196FD68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FC49FBE0DFE3013196FC68A86D17958E.description: Describe dance elements used in personal work and that of others.

FC497190DFE3013196FA68A86D17958E.description: Expand the ability to incorporate spatial and time concepts in movement problems (e.g., select and combine three locomotor movements traveling in three different path-ways and using three different tempos).

FC492610DFE3013196F968A86D17958E.description: Perform short movement problems, emphasizing the element of force/energy (e.g., swing, melt, explode, quiver).

FC48CFA0DFE3013196F868A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FC488B80DFE3013196F768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to start, change, and stop movement.

FC4843A0DFE3013196F668A86D17958E.description: Combine and perform basic locomotor skills, moving on a specific pathway (e.g., skip in circles, slide in zigzags, run in a variety of linear paths). Combine and perform locomotor and axial movements (e.g., walk and turn, stretch and slide).

FC47FB00DFE3013196F568A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills and Technical Expertise

FC47AEB0DFE3013196F468A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception – Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
